channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Van abandoned on Albion drive in pay and display bay, 19th June
item.description:
This van has been abandoned for 3 weeks on Albion drive, E8 4LX. It has accumulated tickets. It is taking up spaces that I park in as a resident. I am disabled and have no dedicated bay and this is closest to my property so causing significant issues

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albion Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large paladin bin full of waste dumped on path, 19th June
item.description:
Green paladin bin full of waste has been dumped on pathway opposite Preston court the crescent and marston fort. It isn’t the estate bins. Full of waste. Was left on road but has been wheeled onto pathway blocking access. Can it be removed please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Town Centre Litter Bins Full & Overflowing, 19th June
item.description:
Mayplace Road West / Market Square, Bexleyheath - at the Bus Stops opposite The Furze Wren Pub: Please empty two full and overflowing public litter bins which were not emptied all day on Thursday 19th June by your contractor - Countrystyle. The Town Centre litter bins are scheduled to be emptied daily however clearly this is not happening as per the attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Place, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 50 Chalk Farm road NW1, 19th June
item.description:
I am a resident who lives at 5 Kent house Ferdinand street London NW1 8ET. I live on the 2nd floor & there’s a huge tree or bush growing & has been growing for a number of years. It has become so big & tall now that it’s reached the bottom of my window. A lot of bees/wasps/flys & bugs are coming in to my window. The tree or bush seems to be in the garden of an abandoned property. This property encountered a fire about 3 years an ago & still looks abandoned. The is 50 Chalk Farm road the shop name says Louis coca. Please can someone look into this & try to remove this bush or hedge it’s becoming very inconvenient now because of the weather it’s getting more warm the volumes fly’s is increasing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalk Farm Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked in the loading bay, 19th June
item.description:
Cars are constantly parking blocking traffic turning left at the lights. As well as preventing the bus from continuing straight from the bus stop. This loading bay is a permanent hindrance at peak times.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, New Southgate, London

item.title: Tree branches blocking footpath/pavement, 19th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Road, Elmstead, London

item.title: Arnside road - deweeding and cleaning, 19th June
item.description:
Arnside Road pavement on both sides of the roads have excess weeds growing throughout. In addition, litter/waste across the road and pavement including drink cans/bottles, balloons, and nappies. There is also an excessive smell of urine following numerous people urinating on the road. Road sweeping machine does do the rounds now and then but due to parked cars the area is left uncleaned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 162, Arnside Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins causing an obstruction, 19th June
item.description:
Bins are left outside 5, 7 and 9 park Grove, Bexleyheath 365 days of the year and block the pavement to wheelchair users and cause an obstruction / tripping hazard to blind and visually impaired pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Grove, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Tulsemere Road SE27 outside house number 71, 19th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Tulsemere Road, Tulse Hill, London
